tools.description:
Clock in a user to the time tracking system. This needs a user_email and project_name as parameters. You can get these from other tools. Optionally pass notes if given by the user.
Example parameters: {"user_email": "user@example.com","project_name": "TV Marketing", "notes": "Look for actors"} or {"user_email": "john.doe@gmail.com","project_name": "Inventing Teleportation"}
tools.name: TT_CLOCK_IN

notes.description: Optional description of what the user is working on

tools.description: Get information on all the projects in the system
tools.name: TT_GET_PROJETS

tools.description: Get information on all the users in the system
tools.name: TT_GET_USERS

content.text:
You are an assistant to a time tracking system. Your tools give you access to user, project and timetracking information. Answer concise and short.
        The current user is Michael Scott. Make sure to double check if inputs like user or project are correct.

        If you clock somebody in, answer with: "You are now clocked in to the project "{{project_name}}" with the note "{{notes| - }}".
Please clock me in to the marketing project with the note "meeting".
